faqBlock.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqBlock.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about our center

items.question: How to schedule a consultation?
items.answer: You can schedule a consultation through the form on our website, by phone, or by sending a request to our email. Our specialists will contact you within 24 hours to confirm your appointment.

items.question: What documents are required to participate in the programs?
items.answer: To participate in the programs, you need a passport, an application form, and, depending on the program, additional documents confirming your eligibility. You can get a complete list of documents for a specific program from our consultants.

items.question: Can I get support remotely?
items.answer: Yes, most of our consultations and programs are available in an online format. We use modern video communication tools to ensure high-quality remote interaction with our clients.

items.question: What are the benefits of membership in the center's community?
items.answer: Membership in our center's community provides access to exclusive events, discounts on paid services, the opportunity to participate in closed programs, as well as regular information newsletters and priority registration for popular events.

items.question: How to become a volunteer at the center?
items.answer: To become a volunteer, fill out the application form on our website in the "Volunteering" section. After reviewing your application, we will invite you for an interview where we will discuss possible areas of cooperation and work schedule.

questions.question: How to apply for document recognition?
questions.answer: To apply for document recognition, you need to fill out an application and provide the necessary documents to our center.

questions.question: How long does the recognition procedure take?
questions.answer: The recognition procedure takes from 30 to 45 working days from the moment of submitting a complete package of documents.

questions.question: What documents are needed for accreditation?
questions.answer: For accreditation, it is necessary to provide constituent documents, licenses, curricula and programs, as well as other documents according to the list.

educationRegistry.pageSubtitle: Unified registry of higher professional education programs implemented in higher educational institutions of the Republic of Kazakhstan
educationRegistry.infoBlock: The registry of educational programs contains information about higher and postgraduate education programs implemented by universities in Kazakhstan. Here you can find detailed information about specialties, qualifications, and content of educational programs.

results.error: Failed to load educational program data

aboutRegistry.title: About the Registry of Educational Programs
aboutRegistry.description: The registry of higher and postgraduate education programs is a unified information system containing structured information about educational programs implemented by higher and postgraduate education organizations of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
tasksList: Ensuring transparency and accessibility of information about implemented educational programs
Providing information to employers about graduates' qualifications
Monitoring educational programs to ensure quality of education
aboutRegistry.updates: The registry is constantly updated and supplemented with new educational programs as they are developed and approved by higher educational institutions.

aboutPage.title: About the Center
aboutPage.subtitle: National Center for Higher Education Development

history.title: History and Mission
history.text1: Kazakhstan, having signed the Bologna Declaration in 2010, became the 47th country participating in the Bologna Process and the first Central Asian state recognized as a full member of the European Higher Education Area.
history.text2: Each participating country assumes obligations to fulfill mandatory, recommended, and optional parameters of the Bologna Process.
history.text3: The Center was established on August 31, 2012, to provide methodological, scientific-methodical, and information-analytical support for implementing the Bologna Process parameters in the Republic of Kazakhstan at the national level.
history.text4: The foundation is the Decree of the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan dated December 7, 2010, No. 1118 "On Approval of the State Program for the Development of Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2011-2020".
